name: 8.5 "The Two Faces of Norm" Trivia Game | 'Cheers'- Season 8 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Rebecca was saying positive things about everyone, who can't she find something positive to say something about?
questions.explanation:
Cliff.

	Cliff said "I got it, no everyone has a pulse." Carla replies, "way to make a dork out of yourself." Rebecca then responds to Carla saying, "Way to nail him Carla!"

questions.text: What did Rebecca suggest Sam sell?
questions.explanation:
his car.

	Sam said that he couldn't sell his car because it was his car. Rebecca said that Sam wouldn't sell it because he was afraid that women would not be attracted to Sam without his corvette. Sam wanting to prove that he could get women with or without his corvette decided to sell it. His theory was once he bought back Cheers he'd make enough money to buy the car back.

questions.text: Who hires some help for his painting work?
questions.explanation:
Norm & Norman.

	Norm's business was picking up and he was finding it hard to manage on his own. The men he hired however were not very good workers.

questions.text: How did Norm do in bowling?
questions.explanation:
broke 200.

	Norm was telling the gang at Cheers how his workers slacked off all the time. He said this time they went bowling and when asked what he did Norm said "I broke 200." Norm was not very assertive so the guys didn't feel the need to work if they didn't want to.

questions.text: Why couldn't Dennis buy what Sam had to sell?
options: He was afraid his wife would be mad.
questions.explanation:
He answered a question wrong.

	Sam asked him a question about driving the car at high noon. When Dennis answered Sam told him he was crazy. He said, "You don't drive this car at high noon" and kicked him out of the bar.

questions.text: What business partner did Norm make up?
questions.explanation:
Anton Kreitzer.

	Norm created this man to be assertive with the workers. It worked well for a while, the men started to actually do the work they were paid to do.

questions.text: What kind of car did Sam buy?
questions.explanation:
volare.

	A couple of women came in the bar and asked him if he owned that car. When he said yes, they laughed and said, "It was him, and he admitted it."

questions.text: How did Norm think of the name he chose as his alter-ego?
questions.explanation:
Vera's maiden name.

	Leave it to Norm to take something related to his wife and make it horrible. At one point Frasier got concerned that Norm could no longer tell the difference between himself and this alter-ego he created.

Doris.

	Doris was played by Cynthia Stevenson. Doris was very grateful to be working for Norm because he was so kind to her.

questions.text: Who bought what Sam had sold?
questions.explanation:
Lilith.

	Sam was desperate to get his car back to the point he was on the phone begging the person who bought it. Then Frasier took the phone and said "Damn it Lilith, give Sam his car back." He said he was tired of all the speeding tickets.
